titles.title: Commemorating 50 years of relations between the United States and the Republic of Korea.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Committee Agreed to Seek Consideration Under Suspension of the Rules, (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Gilman moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 400 - 0 (Roll No. 419).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/9/1998--Passed House amended. Congratulates the Republic of Korea on the 50th anniversary of its founding and commends the Korean people on the peaceful democratic transition that has taken place during the most recent presidential elections. Expresses support for the efforts of the Government of President Kim Dae-jung to address economic problems and confirms that the question of reunification of the Korean Peninsula is a matter for the Korean people to decide.
